{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) is a World Health Organization program that aims to make vaccines available to all children. According to Document [19], the EPI includes vaccines for Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG), diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis (DTP), oral polio (OPV), and measles. However, it does not mention the MMR (measles, mumps, and rubella) vaccine.", "answer_choice": "B"}
